data.title: Flooding continues in 5 southern provinces
data.description: Flooding continued in five southern provinces on Monday, affecting at least 128,000 families, the Department of Disaster Prevention and Mitigation reported.

data.title: Ant International's 2024 Growth: Payments, Digitalisation, Inclusion
data.description: With a series of organisational and strategic upgrades in 2024, Ant International, a leading global digital payment and financial technology provider, reported robust growth over the past year among all its four pillar businesses, Alipay+, Antom, WorldFirst and Embedded Finance.

data.title: 6,600 GHB debtors register for debt restructuring in first 2 days
data.description: The ‘You Fight, We Help’ scheme aims to help 1.9 million borrowers nationwide in a bid to lower household debts

data.title: Myanmar’s war has forced doctors and nurses into prostitution
data.description: After seven years of medical school in Myanmar, May finally achieved her goal of becoming a doctor. But a month after she graduated and found a job, her dreams started unravelling.

data.title: Will Thailand dethrone Singapore as global investment hub in 2025?

data.title: Roads to Nakhon Si Thammarat airport flooded
data.description: Travellers using Nakhon Si Thammarat airport are advised to allow at least three extra hours for travel to and from the airport because of severe traffic congestion on flooded roads.

data.title: Artistic, with insects
data.description: When Thanapat Termsintawee was a third-year student at the School of Fine and Applied Arts, Bangkok University, he conducted a thesis which compared human society to ant colonies. Working on the thesis led him to keep ants and develop a familiarity with the insects.

data.title: Girl falls from octopus ride, seriously injured
data.description: NAKHON RATCHASIMA - A 12-year-old girl was under close watch at a hospital on Monday after falling from an octopus ride at a fair in Pak Chong district.

data.title: Gen Z: World drivers shaping workplace in 2025
data.description: Although Gen Zs have faced criticism for their work abilities, this year will see them revolutionise workplace norms as they step into young managerial roles.

data.title: Oldest human genomes reveal how a small group burst out of Africa
data.description: NEW YORK - About 45,000 years ago, a tiny group of people - fewer than 1,000 - wandered the icy northern fringes of Europe. Across thousands of miles of tundra, they hunted woolly rhinoceros and other big game. Their skin was most likely dark.

data.title: Dot Property Southeast Asia Awards 2024 Illuminate Regional Real Estate Excellence
data.description: The Four Seasons Hotel Bangkok at Chao Phraya River hosted the   Dot Property Southeast Asia Awards 2024 , a prestigious celebration recognising the region’s most outstanding property developers, projects, and agencies. As one of Southeast Asia’s premier awards programmes, the event has established itself as a cornerstone for real estate professionals across the region.

data.title: Thailand to host two regional meetings focused on Myanmar this week
data.description: Thailand said on Monday it will host two regional meetings on Myanmar this week, with at least one to have representatives of the junta, as the Malaysian Prime Minister said efforts were being made to bring Myanmar back to the fore of Asean.

data.title: BSRC Receives 2024 Recognition Pin for Emergency Medical Service Excellence
data.description: Bangchak  Sriracha Public Company Limited (BSRC) has been honoured with the 2024 Recognition Pin from the National Institute of Emergency Medicine (NIEM) in the complimentary category. This prestigious accolade recognises the company’s steadfast dedication to enhancing emergency medical services and its effective collaboration with NIEM to respond to critical situations.

data.title: Flood hits heart of Nakhon Si Thammarat
data.description: NAKHON SI THAMMARAT - A flash flood hit the centre of this southern province late Sunday night and into Monday morning after persistent rain, leaving many roads impassable.

data.title: Senate likely to stand behind referendum pick
data.description: The Senate will meet on Tuesday to vote on the referendum bill on constitutional amendments with majority of senators expected to stand firmly by the divisive double-majority rule.

data.title: Myanmar energy investments exceed $26.5 billion by November 2024
data.description: Myanmar’s energy sector had attracted more than US$26.5 billion in foreign investment as of the end of November 2024, accounting for 28.43 % of the total foreign investment, according to figures released by the Department of Investment and Companies Administration (DICA).

data.title: Thai PM arrives in Malaysia for official two-day visit
data.description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra arrived in Malaysia on Sunday (Dec 15) to begin a two-day official visit at the invitation of Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.

data.title: SAC Chair urges end to conflicts in 50th Rakhine State Day message
